column1: The rush of the water and the booming of the mill bring a dreamy deafness
column2: which seems to heighten the peacefulness of the scene. They are like a great curtain of sound
column3: shutting one out from the world beyond. And now there is the thunder of the huge covered wagon coming home with sacks of grain. That honest wagoner is thinking of his dinner
column4: getting sadly dry in the oven at this late hour; but he will not touch it till he has fed his horses
column10: are looking mild reproach at him from between their blinkers
column11: that he should crack his whip at them in that awful manner as if they needed that hint! See how they stretch their shoulders up the slope toward the bridge
column12: with all the more energy because they are so near home. Look at their grand shaggy feet that seem to grasp the firm earth
column13: at the patient strength of their necks
column15: at the mighty muscles of their struggling haunches!
